meanings.sent1: The cheetah speeded across the savannah.
meanings.sent2: I speeded up when I heard the bell ring.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race to see who could speeded the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Her heart speeded like a race car engine as she approached the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The wind speeded through the trees, creating a symphony of rustling leaves.

meanings.definition: To increase the rate of motion or progress
meanings.sent1: The train speeded along the tracks towards its destination.
meanings.sent2: We need to speeded up our work to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel speeded up its nut-gathering to prepare for winter.
meanings.sent4: The news of the promotion speeded up her heart with excitement.
meanings.sent5: The river speeded its flow after the heavy rainfall, carrying debris downstream.

meanings.sent1: She speeded her car to catch up with the rest of the convoy.
meanings.sent2: The chef speeded up the cooking process by turning up the heat.
meanings.sent3: The magician speeded through his tricks, leaving the audience amazed.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to speeded up as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The emergency response team speeded to the scene of the accident to provide assistance.
